FuncDef:
The bit-error-detection command enables bit-error-triggered update for a trunk interface.
The undo bit-error-detection command disables bit-error-triggered update for a trunk interface.
By default, bit-error-triggered update is disabled for a trunk interface.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After the bit-error-detection command is run, if a local member interface reports a bit error alarm, both the local and peer member interfaces go down, and the local and peer Eth-Trunk interfaces disable the member interfaces from forwarding traffic. After the bit error alarm is cleared, the member interfaces go up, and the Eth-Trunk interfaces enable the member interfaces to forward traffic again. An Eth-Trunk interface goes down when the number of member interfaces in the Up state falls below the configured lower threshold.
Follow-up Procedure
After you run this command, run the mpls te reverse-lsp protocol rsvp-te ingress-lsr-id tunnel-id command in the tunnel interface view to specify the reverse tunnel for the current tunnel.
